column4: ok, the problem with grub not loading at boot time is gone, but now grub doesn
the menu.lst entry says "kernel /boot/vmlinuz-2.6.17-10-generic root=/dev/sda3 ro quiet splash"
the /dev/sda3 is my linux partition and the kernel lies in that path also
do you have a SATA or an IDE drive?
after doing the installation from the desktop live cd i still had windows booting instead of grub so i booted the cd again
ok that gives me all the partitions showing me that /dev/sda3 is the linux partition
what does root partition mean? it's the partition i installed my linux into
look at pastebin.com/843914 that the dump
im going to dump my /boot/grub/menu.lst for you
mine is the same except that it's hd1,2
whats the error you're getting again?
